NEW YORK Efforts Of south
ern NAACP leaders to raise funds
for building fire damaged
churches have been endorsed
by the National Association for
the Advancement Of Colored Peo-
pie.


The churches, each pastored
by an NAACP branch president,
are located in Hot Springs, Ark;
Baton Rouge, La: and Charles
ton, sc. Each Of the clergymen
has been an active leader In the
civil rights struggle.


The largest, 100000 struc-
ture. was the Roanoke Baptist
Church In Hot Springs. Ark. The
church, of which the Rev. James
Donald Rice Is pastor. was ruined
by fire Of apparent incendiary
origin on the night of last Dec.
81. Mr.. Rice, president Of the Hot
Springs NAACP branch. has
pearheaded the successful drive
to desegregate the federally-
owned baths in that city as we'll
as other facilities, including the
public schools.


His church, one Of the city
largest, was often attended by
visiting white Baptists who came
to Hot Springs for the health
baths. A fund to rebuild his church
has been established. Contribu-
tions may be sent directly to
the Roanoke Baptist Church
Building Fund, P. 0. Box l2Ol,
Hot Springs, Ark.


In Baton Rouge, La, Greene's
Chapel, A.M.E., was damaged by
fire early last Easter Sunday
morning Pastor of the church is
the Rev. Arthur L. Jelks who,
as president of the NAACP
branch, led the drive in that city
for desegregation Of public &C
commodations and expansion OF
job opportunities for Negroes. A
sum of $4,000 is needed to
repair damage done by the fire.


The Norris Street Baptist
Church in Chaleston, pastored
by the Rev. A. R. Blake, suf-
fered damages amounting to
SI5O,OOO as the result of fire.
Mr.. Blake, as president of the
NAACP branch, had led the cam
paign in Charleston last summer
which resulted in the desegre-
CATION of a leading hotel and OF
some of the citys best restau-
rants. The drive also opened up
new job opportunities for Ne
groes.

Sturf To


Rebuild In South

will be available during these
hours.


Service at post office windows
on Saturdays will be limited to
stamp sales. parcel post receiv-
ing, registry, GODS and will
call services.

tional parks, monuments, and

ing 1868. a gain Of 9.S percent
over the previous year. Grand

Canyon National Park alone at
tracted a record l,538.700 Wis


itors last year = an increase Of
$4,000 over the previous year.
